intro: Portlandia daphnoides, commonly known as the silverleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Chile. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage, which features a distinctive silvery-white underside. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in spring, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens across temperate climates.
